title: 106_hr1829
content: The Air Force plays a role in managing the Civil Air Patrol as a civilian auxiliary. The Air Force manages the Civil Air Patrol as a civilian auxiliary, with administrative responsibility under the Chief of Staff of the Air Force and a National Board of Directors appointed by the Secretary of the Air Force. The National Board of Directors for the Civil Air Patrol includes senior civilian employees of the Department of the Air Force and members appointed from the volunteer Civil Air Patrol membership. The chairman is the senior active duty Air Force officer. The Board appoints a National Commander, Executive Director, Safety Officer, and Inspector General. The Executive Director, Safety Officer, and Inspector General report directly to the Secretary of the Air Force through the Board. The Chief of Staff of the Air Force can assign Air Force officers, enlisted members, and civilian employees to serve at the national headquarters of the Civil Air Patrol. The appointment or assignment of armed forces members or civilian employees to Civil Air Patrol positions is allowed, with no additional compensation beyond regular military pay. The Executive Director and National Board of Directors can utilize CAP employees and volunteers as needed for administration and noncombat mission support. The Civil Air Patrol assists the Department of the Air Force in noncombat missions. Members and employees are not considered Federal employees and are not subject to related laws. However, the Secretary of the Air Force can set conduct standards. Funds provided to the Civil Air Patrol are subject to federal regulations on appropriated funds to nonprofit organizations. The Civil Air Patrol receives appropriated funds from the government, and its powers are subject to approval by the Secretary of the Air Force. Amendments are made to the table of sections in the chapter. The Civil Air Patrol receives government funds and its powers are approved by the Secretary of the Air Force. Air Force plays a role in management and there is assistance from other agencies.
